page.title: 19The Pury End Carpenter
page.content:
The village carpenter's name is Leonard Goff and he lives at 54 Careys Road in Pury End. His main interests are cycling, painting and driving his 1933 MG. He discovered the MG in Somerset in 1982 and restored it himself. He usually paints about six water colours a year.
As well as being a carpenter he restores antiques. The oldest piece of furniture he has restored dates from the 17th century. He gets his wood from Norwich and Brixworth. He thinks the most useful handtool is the tenon saw and the most useful electric tool is the circular saw.
